history.text: Hi, what movie did you get to discuss?
Home Alone surprisingly enough, one of my favorite movies as a child. Did you find it entertaining?
Yes! I loved Home Alone - so funny!
Haha - do you think you would have been able to construct any of those "traps" at that age? I mean to me it just seems a bit far-fetched at that age
What did you like about it?
Like a lot movies the adults are portrayed as stupid and kids as genius'
Well, around that age we tend to "know it all". Do you think any of the characters should have been played by someone more "fitting"?
Good question ... Macauly Culkin (sp?) was perfect
I couldn't think of getting rid of Daniel Stern but Joe Pesci was far from my favorite choice for that one
How would you feel if they ended up doing a remake of those movies?
I thought they did a Home Alone 2 didnt they?

I want to say they did (?), how do you think you would have felt if you were in Kevin's position and you just got outright left by your family for vacation? Not only that why didn't they just come back for their 8 year old?
Agree - that was harsh, I would have been angry but he seemed to be glad for a while - eating whatever he wanted.

As a kid, yea, all that junk food would have been amazing. Did you
 happen to have any brothers like Buzz in the movie?
No, thankfully not - Buzz was absolutely annoying.

That is so absolutely true, I remember being able to relate to Kevin because of that (my brother was a nightmare to live with). Did you end up finding in humorous when he wished for his family to disappear and his mind they did?
Yes, it was like magic ... sometimes what we really hope for does come true.
Have you ever had any issues trying to get back home on flights like Kate did in the movie as she was trying to get back home to Chicago?
Yes, I once was delayed 72 hours in chicago ohare because of a snowstorm ... it was horrible.

Oh no O'Hare is the worst place to be stranded, ended up getting stranded there for roughly the same amount of time back in 2003 lol. Would you ever end up accepting a ride with a traveling polka band to get around being stranded like that?
I would never accept a ride in this day and age ... you never fully know people.
Do you think it was a safer choice back in the 90's when the movie came out?
Perhaps, but even then I still wouldnt

uid1response.feedback: I enjoyed the conversation and the other user was very nice!
